General Styles

Colors

There are 7 color ranges, each having 7 shades.

Each can be accessed as a variable by name. For example:

  • background: var(--lightest-gray)
  • color: var(--darkest-red)

Code

Some filenamepath and more below:

\nul.a {
  list-style-type: circle;
    }
    ul.b {
      list-style-type: square;
    }
    ol.c {
      list-style-type: upper-roman;
    }
    ol.d {
      list-style-type: lower-alpha;
    }

Browser Native Input Controls

Radio



Checkboxes




Select

option elements have limited styling controls as most, if not all browsers, use the OS native control for drop-downs.

If more granular control of a select control's appearance are required, use the Select.svelte component instead.

radioValue: first

Click on me to edit

Date Input

Date Input

Masked input of numbers

Translated Inputs

Translated Inputs

Takes a raw input and translates the value for saving. The current translation appears on the right.

One way of looking at this is that the translation means "This is what I think you mean, and this is what I will be saving."

This input is useful for keyboard focused apps for entering time and dates without a picker or mask.

In this sense, translated inputs can be a friendlier way of collecting data without forcing users to stick to a format.

Example use cases:

  • Postal codes - force uppercase and strip spaces
  • Phone numbers
  • Date translation
Translates input to all caps

Time Input

Examples: 0800, 1700, 5p, 6a, 09:30

Duration Input

Examples: 2h, 15m, 120m, 1d
